property.type_description: Automatically generated from the team list
property.name: Co-owner

card.name: 19. Verify total balance of a Monetary, offer agnostic, consumer owned DAs and SetProductMonetaryDAValue modifier
card.description:
Description

 

This test should verified that:
  • The new structure MUST provide a Field to return the sum of all the DA balance of a DAId of all active products irrespective of Offer ID it belongs to.
  • FlexibleAnnouncements structure introduces new field for the sum of Monetary DAs (another testcase for a field for NonMonetary DAs) the above-mentioned point is possible for consumer owned DAs (another testcase for shared DAs)
  • In FI, Balance should return the balance available at call set-up (without reservation)
  • In II, Balance should return the balance available after the debit in Intermediate Interrogation (without reservation)

 

As for the SetProductMonetaryDAValue modifier this testcase should verify that:
  • tree will have support to calculate the sum of all the monetary DA instances of DA[x] for those DAs that belongs to an Offer ID
 
 
NOTE: The same scenario can be used for non-monetary DA scenario

card.name: SDP - C220-35 Update sl4j 3PP from 1.6.1 to 1.8.0-beta2
card.description:
Progress in % of the BSUC:

 

{{ value query: SELECT 'Progress % of BSUC' WHERE type = THIS CARD.type AND name = THIS CARD.name }}

Description

3PP LCM: Update sl4j 3PP from 1.6.1 to 1.8.0-beta2

Copied Cards Information

This information is only accessible in the BSS-Portfolio area, on the copied card in the program area this information will not exist.

Card copied to destination project {{ value query: SELECT 'destination_project_identifier' WHERE Type = THIS CARD.type AND name = THIS CARD.name }}
 
Card copied to destination card no. {{ value query: SELECT 'destination_card_number' WHERE Type = THIS CARD.type AND name = THIS CARD.name }}

 

 

Classic SDP Definition of Done (DOD)

https://erilink.ericsson.se/eridoc/erl/objectId/09004cff86dbc91e?docno=1/15901-9/FCP116254Uen&action=current&format=excel8book

 

RM Definition of Done (DOD)

https://erilink.ericsson.se/eridoc/erl/objectId/09004cff8980d7e3?docno=BUSS-15:000377Uen&action=approved&format=pdf

Area Details OK/NOK  Comments

Progress reporting (EPIC/BSUC)
  • All BSUC related EPICs are set to IMPLEMENTED and all User Stories, and ETs are set to DONE.
  • Progress of BSUC 100% ready (visible in Mingle preferred).
    
Demo
  • Held demos for stakeholders during implementation (ex. Sprint demos etc.)
    • Responded to feedback from demo sessions.
  • Final demo (or video) held.
    • Responded to feedback from demo session.
    
Code Quality
  • Code is compliant with TPG code rules/conventions following BSS/OSS Design Rules. 
  • All code is reviewed correct peers (BSS/OSS RM).
  • Added functionality is covered by function control in accordance to definition in BSUC.
  • Added/changed functionality covered by unit tests.
    
Design Documentation
  • Maven site updated.
  • Java doc updated.
  • JSDoc updated.
  • SPARX updated (if applicable). Review by modelling team has been done.
    
No known faults/defects/bugs   

If any known faults, the deviation exemption process shall be followed.
(See RM Development DoD; page10)

    
Test Scope

Test scope executed according to BSUC test analysis, including but not limited to:  (See RM Test wow).

  • All simulators updated.
  • All automated and manual test cases passed.
  • Exploratory testing executed.
  • Automated test cases tagged (@tags).
  • Black box test in place for affected services, such as GUI or REST.
  • Non functional test for new functionality secured (either by team or in agreement with LSV team).
  

 

 
PI

BSUC defined impact on documentation is synced with Product Information team.

  • If BSUC implementation is relying on configuration not guided by the UX/UI; then a d escription how configuration in UI should be done is in sync with the PI team.
  • External/public interface description updated.
    
Legal

Valid if this BSUC introduced new 3PPs or new versions of existing 3PPs, (shall be documented in BSUC study)

  • All embedded 3PPs approved by DAT.
  • All embedded 3PPs used are officially released.
  • 3PP/FOSS approved.
  • Release Tech and Build Masters aware of the 3PP change.
    

Operation & Maintenance

BSUC defined changes is implemented for the following areas:

  • Logging, Tracing, Alarms & Counters
    

Security

Security SPOC have reviewed Security chapter in BSUC. Possible actions identified by the security team has been taken care of.

(If no security impact is identified, answer OK with a comment)

    
Upgrade and Backwards compatibility
  • BSUC described impact on Upgrade, Migration or Installation are communicated to COD team and secured.
  • Any TPG internal upgrade, migration or installation item is secured.
    
Reuse                

Any useful reusable component communicated to applicable stakeholders? (See Reuse Common component Design rules).

    

Ux

UI implementation is in accordance with UX specification and Ux study (HiFi/LoFi).

    

Internal interface handling

 Internal interface coordination matrix updated between TPGs  (if applicable).    

BSUC Study and implementation is in sync
  • BSUC study is updated to cover all statements in this DoD.
  • BSUC study is updated to reflect potential changes during Implementation.
  • Implementation is according to definition in BSUC study.
  • BSUC study set to sharp revision in Eridoc.
    

 

EPICs connected to BSUC

{{ table query: SELECT number, name, 'Status - EPIC', 'Assigned Team', 'EPIC Points', 'Progress % of EPIC' WHERE Type = 'Epic' AND 'Business Sub Use Case' = THIS CARD }}

 

Total EPIC Story Points

Total EPIC Story Points - Ongoing/Done
{{ daily-history-chart start-date: THIS CARD.'Planned Product Start' end-date: THIS CARD.'Planned Product Finish' chart-conditions: type = 'EPIC' AND 'Business Sub Use Case' = THIS CARD AND 'Status - EPIC' != Discarded AND 'Status - Epic' != Preliminary x-labels-step: 30 chart-height: 310 chart-width: 600 series: - data: SELECT SUM ('EPIC Points') WHERE 'Status - EPIC' != 'Discarded' AND 'Status - Epic' != Preliminary label: Total EPIC Story Points color: blue }}

 

 {{ daily-history-chart start-date: THIS CARD.'Planned Product Start' end-date: THIS CARD.'Planned Product Finish' chart-conditions: type = 'EPIC' AND 'Business Sub Use Case' = THIS CARD AND ('Status - EPIC' = Ongoing OR 'Status - Epic' = Done) x-labels-step: 30 chart-height: 310 chart-width: 600 series: - data: SELECT SUM ('Progress of EPIC Estimate') WHERE 'Status - EPIC' = Ongoing OR 'Status - Epic' = Done label: Total EPIC Story Points - Ongoing/Done color: blue }}

 


 Note: Do not modify or remove any of the reports

Remaining ET hours

(Not couting hours in Preliminary & Discarded status)

card.name: PC:21835 Offer and OfferAttribute support in FlexibleAnn -ensure correctness
card.description:
Description

There was concern in commit PC:21835 Offer and OfferAttribute support in FlexibleAnn that was first expressed as TODO in code and then two other TODO in commit messages

https://gerrit.epk.ericsson.se/#/c/424806/53/psc-sdpere/src/com/ericsson/charging/psc/sdpere/FlexibleAnnouncementDataSet.java

    public Calendar getCurrentLocalTime()
    {
        if (myCurrentLocalTime == null)
        {
            // TODO: PC:21835, 20171011, eadovic to be analyzed if this is correct implementation or not. test both with and without PC:18939
            myCurrentLocalTime = Calendar.getInstance(getSubscriber().getTimeZone());
            myCurrentLocalTime.setTimeInMillis(SECONDS.toMillis(myOperationData.getLocalTimeInSeconds()));
        }
        return myCurrentLocalTime;

 

Thus, we need to ensure the above gets tested and analyzed properly. (removed the TODO from the code in favor of tracking the task here in mingle).

 


PC:21835 Offer and OfferAttribute support in FlexibleAnn.

Added fields to support branching on offers in
FlexibleAnnouncement tree.

Fields:
* Timer Offer ID
* Offer start time
* Offer expiry time
* FIELD Timer offer remaining time VIRTUAL
* Active Offer ID
* FIELD Active Offer IN
* CurrentLocalDateTime

FieldGenerator
* OfferAttribute (not supporting productattributes)

Condition
* Active Offer List

TODO: Verify if these fields will suffice or not.

Simulation seems to work. (not possible to simulate products,
not sure that is required).

TODO: Simulation for currentlocaldatetime not present
